context:
Listener: Come to my office, Billy. Look at your messy hair. This is the third time you have been late for class within this week. And every time you went in, you disturbed the teacher's class.
Speaker: Sorry, Miss. I didn't mean to do that, but it was my alarm clock that didn't wake me up.
Listener: That is not a proper excuse. You could set it ahead of the exact time so that you could have got up earlier and not have been late.
Speaker: I did that, but it seemed useless when I found the batteries had run out after I woke up this morning. I rushed to school and luckily, my neighbour Mr. Green gave me a hand and took me to school with his car.
Listener: So you could have made it. But you were still late for class.
Speaker: The thing is, when I got off, I found I had left my bag in his car. And it was too late to get it back when I realized that. I went straight to the nearest shop and gave him a call. I waited for five minutes before Mr. Green drove back.
Listener: Finally, he gave you your bag and you came to the classroom and you were already 15 minutes late for class at that time. Is that all?
Speaker: Miss, you seem to know the entire story. May I go back to class now? Otherwise I will be late for the following class.
question: What prerequisites are required for the last thing said to occur?
a1: the school bell rings to start the second class.
a2: for this to happen, the teacher must have been convinced by billy's explanation and excuse for being late.

Speaker: Five and a half years . We moved here on the first of November .
Listener: You have a fantastic view .
Speaker: Yes . I love living here .
Listener: Look ! You can see the village way down in the valley .
Speaker: Yes . It ’ s a lovely view .
question: What prerequisites are required for the last thing said to occur?
a1: there is a beautiful village located in the valley.
a2: the weather condition on that day is clear enough for the speaker to see the village and its surroundings.

context: Speaker: Lisa , I'm home .
question: What prerequisites are required for the last thing said to occur?
a1: lisa recognizes the speaker's voice and replies in some way.
a2: lisa and the speaker live together in the same apartment.

context:
Listener: Hey Rachael , what's up ? How is your day ?
Speaker: Not bad.We have had a big meeting today , remember ?
Listener: Oh , yea . I forgot.So how did it go ?
Speaker: Pretty well . I think the boss liked my ideas .
question: What prerequisites are required for the last thing said to occur?
a1: rachael has joined her company recently.
a2: the speaker had a good rapport with the boss and had built a level of trust and credibility over time.

context:
Listener: police station , can i help you ?
Speaker: yes , i 'm calling to tell you i found a car . i thought it might be a stolen car .
question: What prerequisites are required for the last thing said to occur?
a1: the speaker is sufficiently concerned about a possible stolen car to report it to the police station.
a2: the car has been abandoned.

context:
Listener: Come to my office, Billy. Look at your messy hair. This is the third time you have been late for class within this week. And every time you went in, you disturbed the teacher's class.
Speaker: Sorry, Miss. I didn't mean to do that, but it was my alarm clock that didn't wake me up.
Listener: That is not a proper excuse. You could set it ahead of the exact time so that you could have got up earlier and not have been late.
Speaker: I did that, but it seemed useless when I found the batteries had run out after I woke up this morning. I rushed to school and luckily, my neighbour Mr. Green gave me a hand and took me to school with his car.
Listener: So you could have made it. But you were still late for class.
Speaker: The thing is, when I got off, I found I had left my bag in his car. And it was too late to get it back when I realized that. I went straight to the nearest shop and gave him a call. I waited for five minutes before Mr. Green drove back.
Listener: Finally, he gave you your bag and you came to the classroom and you were already 15 minutes late for class at that time. Is that all?
Speaker: Miss, you seem to know the entire story. May I go back to class now? Otherwise I will be late for the following class.
question: What prerequisites are required for the last thing said to occur?
a1: the school bell rings to start the second class.
a2: for this to happen, the teacher must have been convinced by billy's explanation and excuse for being late.

context:
Listener: Give me enough for a skirt , will you ?
Speaker: Here you are.It ' s 90 yuan , miss .
Listener: Can you give me a discount ?
Speaker: 20 percent is the best discount I can offer . That will came to 72yuan .
question: What prerequisites are required for the last thing said to occur?
a1: there is a sale going on in the store.
a2: for this to happen, the listener must not negotiate further for a lower price than the offered 20 percent discount.
